de.lmu.ifi.dbs.jfeaturelib.features

Class LocalBinaryPatterns

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.jfeaturelib.features.AbstractFeatureDescriptor
      • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.jfeaturelib.features.LocalBinaryPatterns
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Descriptor, FeatureDescriptor

    public class LocalBinaryPatterns
extends AbstractFeatureDescriptor
    Constructs a histogram of local binary patterns (LBP) for each pixel.

    For each pixel a histogram of LBP is constructed from all pixels in the region specified by setNeighborhoodSize(int). In this region the LBP is calculated for every pixel. The LBP is calculated by comparing the pixel intensities of the central pixel to N neighboring pixels (setNumPoints(int)) on a circle of radius r (setRadius(double)). Interpolation is used to retrieve the intensity of neighboring pixels.

    The first two features represent the x and y coordinates of the pixel, the remaining features the histogram of local binary patterns (see setNumberOfHistogramBins(int)).

    In comparison to MeanIntensityLocalBinaryPatterns, this class computes one histogram of each pixel and computes local binary patterns from neighbors lying on a circle around the central pixel.

    References: 

    

    Author:
    
  
    sebp
    

    See Also:
    MeanIntensityLocalBinaryPatterns

        getDescription
        

        public String getDescription()
        

        Description copied from interface: FeatureDescriptor
        

        Returns a short plain Text description about the Descriptor and the
 semantics of the double array obtained from FeatureDescriptor.getFeatures().

 May return null if no description is implemented - even though this
 should be avoided by any means.
        

        Returns:
        semantic description of getFeatures or null.

        run
        

        public void run(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        

        Description copied from interface: Descriptor
        

        Start processing of this algorithm on the given image processor. Keep in
 mind that if the imageProcessor is changed, Supports.NoChanges must not
 be set.

 This is also the case even if only ImageProcessor.snapshot() is used.

        setNumPoints
        

        public void setNumPoints(int numPoints)
        

        Number of neighbors to consider.
 
        
 All neighbors lie equally spaced on a circle determined by setRadius(double).

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        

        IllegalArgumentException - if radius <= 0
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        setNeighborhoodSize
        

        public void setNeighborhoodSize(int neighborhoodSize)
        

        Set the size of the neighborhood that is considered to construct a histogram
 of binary patterns for each pixel.
 
        
 For instance, a neighborhood size of 1 considers the 8-neighborhood of each
 pixel, and a neighborhood size of 2 the 25-neighborhood. The neighborhood
 is always quadractic.
 
        

        Parameters:
        neighborhoodSize - positive number
        

        •
